gr.demokritos.iit.sproduce.generator

Class ProduceSurface

  • java.lang.Object
    • gr.demokritos.iit.sproduce.generator.ProduceSurface

  • public class ProduceSurface
extends java.lang.Object

    Application which creates a file with a list of real numbers considered as surface heights. The resulting surface is either Gaussian isotropic or non-isotropic.
    The concept of this application is to simulate the production of a square piece of material with characteristics visible on the nano scale.

    Each side has a certain length (-rL) and consists of a number (-N) of points to be provided. Rms height (-h) and correlation length on x axis (-clx) are also needed. The provision of correlation length on y axis (-cly) determinates whether the surface would be isotropic or non-isotropic.

    Input is passed either through an input file (-in), which may contain multiple surfaces' parameters, or through standard input for one surface at a time. Output can be forwarded through file (-out), or standard output, in which case a 3D image is produced.
    Since:
    2018-08

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        argv - N,input_file or (length,rms_height,clx,cly*),output_file*
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Related to input parameters

        Asterisk (*) denotes optional argument.
        Input file(.cvs) format:

        • ",Rms,clx,cly,Skewness,Kurtosis,Area" as a header
        • ID,Rms,clx,cly,Skewness,Kurtosis,Area per line

      • produce

        protected static RandomGaussSurfaceGenerator produce(double[] args_,
                                                     int y_flag,
                                                     int out_flag,
                                                     java.lang.String out_filename)
                                              throws ImError,
                                                     java.io.IOException

        This function creates a surface generator instance, which is loaded with all the needed and provided parameters.
        The resulting surface is a member of the generator class.

        Parameters:
        args_ - Parameters read from input
        y_flag - Determines whether surface will be (non-)isotropic
        out_flag - Determines whether output will be printed to file
        out_filename - Name of output file
        Returns:
        Instance of surface generator
        Throws:
        ImError - If Fourier transformation did not succeed
        java.io.IOException - If there was an error creating or writing to file

      • plot_surface

        protected static void plot_surface(RandomGaussSurfaceGenerator RG)
                            throws java.io.IOException

        Used only with input provided through standard input for one surface at a time.
        The function creates a 3D image with gradient colours which show height differences.
        It provokes a pop-up window with the correspondent figure, that can also be turned at will using the cursor. The produced image is saved as a file.

        Parameters:
        RG - Instance of surface generator class
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        org.jzy3d.chart
